009package Lucas_Kanade;
010
011import ij.IJ;
012import ij.ImagePlus;
013import ij.gui.Overlay;
014import ij.gui.Roi;
015import ij.gui.ShapeRoi;
016import ij.plugin.filter.PlugInFilter;
017import ij.process.FloatProcessor;
018import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
019import imagingbook.lib.image.ImageExtractor;
020import imagingbook.lib.math.Matrix;
021import imagingbook.lib.settings.PrintPrecision;
022import imagingbook.pub.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
023import imagingbook.pub.geometry.basic.Pnt2d.PntDouble;
024import imagingbook.pub.geometry.basic.Pnt2d.PntInt;
025import imagingbook.pub.geometry.mappings.linear.ProjectiveMapping2D;
026import imagingbook.pub.lucaskanade.LucasKanadeForwardMatcher;
027import imagingbook.pub.lucaskanade.LucasKanadeInverseMatcher;
028import imagingbook.pub.lucaskanade.LucasKanadeMatcher;
029
030
031import java.awt.Color;
032import java.awt.Rectangle;
033import java.awt.geom.Path2D;
034import java.awt.geom.Rectangle2D;
035import java.util.Random;
036
037
038/**
039 * This ImageJ plugin is a minimalistic example of using the Lucas-Kanade
040 * matchers. It performs a single test run on the current image, which is used
041 * as the search image I. A rectangular selection is required, which is used 
042 * to calculate the initial mapping (Tinit) for the matcher. This is where the 
043 * search starts. 
044 * The reference image R is extracted from I out of a warped patch, which is 
045 * obtained by perturbing (adding Gaussian noise with specified sigma) the 
046 * corners of the selected ROI. Note that the disturbance is applied to all 4 
047 * corners of the ROI, thus only a projective (4-point homography) warp can 
048 * recover an accurate match!
049 * Note that the plotted boundaries are 1 pixel smaller (in x/y) than the original
050 * ROI, because the original quad vertices are assumed to be positioned at pixel 
051 * centers. Thus if the ROI is 2 pixels wide, the corresponding quad only has width 1.
052 * 
053 * <p>The following steps are performed:</p>
054 * <ul>
055 * <li>Step 0: Create the search image I.</li>
056 * <li>Step 1: Get the rectangle of the ROI, create the (empty) reference image R of the same size.</li>
057 * <li>Step 2: Get the corner points (Q) of the ROI.</li>
058 * <li>Step 3: Perturb the ROI corners to form the quad QQ and extract the reference image R.</li>
059 * <li>Step 4: Create the Lucas-Kanade matcher (forward or inverse).</li>
060 * <li>Step 5: Calculate the initial mapping Tinit from (centered) R &rarr; Q.</li>
061 * <li>Step 6: Calculate the real mapping from (centered) R &rarr; QQ (for validation only).</li>
062 * <li>Step 7: Initialize the matcher and run the matching loop.</li>
063 * <li>Step 8: Evaluate the results.</li>
064 * </ul>
065 * 
066 * @author WB
067 */
068public class LucasKanade_Demo implements PlugInFilter {
069        
070        static int maxIterations = 100;
071        static double tolerance = 0.0001;
072        static double sigma = 2.5;
073        static boolean drawBoundaries = true;
074        static boolean forwardMatcher = true;
075        
076        static {PrintPrecision.set(6);}
077        
078        ImagePlus img = null;
079        Overlay oly = null;
080
081        public int setup(String args, ImagePlus img) {
082                this.img = img;
083                return DOES_8G + ROI_REQUIRED;
084        }
085
086        public void run(ImageProcessor ip) {            
087                Roi roi = img.getRoi();
088                if (roi != null && roi.getType() != Roi.RECTANGLE) {
089                        IJ.error("Rectangular selection required!)");
090                        return;
091                }
092                
093                // Step 1: Create the search image I:
094                FloatProcessor I = ip.convertToFloatProcessor();
095                
096                // Step 2: Create the (empty) reference image $R$:
097                Rectangle roiR = roi.getBounds();
098                FloatProcessor R = new FloatProcessor(roiR.width, roiR.height);
099                
100                // Step 3: Perturb the ROI corners to form the quad QQ and extract the reference image R:
101                Pnt2d[] Q  = getCornerPoints(roiR);
102                Pnt2d[] QQ = perturbGaussian(Q);
103                (new ImageExtractor(I)).extractImage(R, QQ);
104                //(new ImagePlus("R", R)).show();
105                
106                // Step 4: Create the Lucas-Kanade matcher (forward or inverse):
107                LucasKanadeMatcher matcher = (forwardMatcher) ?
108                                new LucasKanadeForwardMatcher(I, R) :
109                                new LucasKanadeInverseMatcher(I, R);
110                
111                // Step 5: Calculate the initial mapping Tinit from (centered) R -> Q:
112                ProjectiveMapping2D Tinit = matcher.getReferenceMappingTo(Q);
113                IJ.log("Tinit = " + Matrix.toString(matcher.getParameters(Tinit)));
114
115                // Step 6: Calculate the real mapping from (centered) R -> QQ (for validation only):
116                ProjectiveMapping2D Treal = matcher.getReferenceMappingTo(QQ);
117                IJ.log("Treal = " + Matrix.toString(matcher.getParameters(Treal)));
118                
119                // --------------------------------------------------------------------------
120                // Step 7: Initialize the matcher and run the matching loop:
121                ProjectiveMapping2D T = Tinit;
122                do {
123                        T = matcher.iterateOnce(T);             // returns null if iteration failed
124                        int i = matcher.getIteration();
125                        double err = matcher.getRmsError();
126                        IJ.log(String.format("Iteration = %d, RMS error = %.2f", i , err));
127                } 
128                while (T != null && !matcher.hasConverged() && 
129                                matcher.getIteration() < maxIterations);
130                // --------------------------------------------------------------------------
131                
132                // Step 8: Evaluate the results:
133                if (T == null || !matcher.hasConverged()) {
134                        IJ.log("no match found!");
135                        return;
136                }
137                else {
138                        ProjectiveMapping2D Tfinal = T;
139                        
140                        IJ.log(" ++++++++++++++++ Summary +++++++++++++++++++");
141                        // convert all mappings to projective (for comparison)
142                        ProjectiveMapping2D TinitP = new ProjectiveMapping2D(Tinit);
143                        ProjectiveMapping2D TrealP = new ProjectiveMapping2D(Treal);
144                        ProjectiveMapping2D TfinalP = new ProjectiveMapping2D(Tfinal);
145                        IJ.log("Matcher type: " + matcher.getClass().getSimpleName());
146                        IJ.log("Match found after " + matcher.getIteration() + " iterations.");
147                        IJ.log("Final RMS error " + matcher.getRmsError());
148                        IJ.log("  Tinit  = " + Matrix.toString(matcher.getParameters(TinitP)));
149                        IJ.log("  Treal  = " + Matrix.toString(matcher.getParameters(TrealP)));
150                        IJ.log("  Tfinal = " + Matrix.toString(matcher.getParameters(TfinalP)));
151        
152                        IJ.log("Corners of reference patch:");
153                        Pnt2d[] ptsRef = Treal.applyTo(matcher.getReferencePoints());
154                        for(Pnt2d pt : ptsRef) {
155                                IJ.log("  pt = " + pt.toString());
156                        }
157                        IJ.log("Corners for best match:");
158                        Pnt2d[] ptsFinal = Tfinal.applyTo(matcher.getReferencePoints());
159                        for(Pnt2d pt : ptsFinal) {
160                                IJ.log("  pt = " + pt.toString());
161                        }
162                        
163                        Pnt2d test0 = PntInt.from(0, 0);
164                        IJ.log(" (0,0) by Treal  = " + Treal.applyTo(test0).toString());
165                        IJ.log(" (0,0) by Tfinal = " + Tfinal.applyTo(test0).toString());
166                        
167                        if (drawBoundaries) {
168                                oly = new Overlay();
169                                img.setOverlay(null);
170                                img.setOverlay(oly);
171                                
172                                oly.add(makePolygon(Q, 0.2, Color.green));
173                                oly.add(makePolygon(QQ, 0.5, Color.blue));
174                                oly.add(makePolygon(ptsFinal, 0.2, Color.red));
175                                img.updateAndDraw();
176                        }
177                }
178        }
179        
180        // ----------------------------------------------------------
181        
182        private Pnt2d[] getCornerPoints(Rectangle2D r) {        
183                //IJ.log("getpoints2:  r = " + r.toString());
184                double x = r.getX();
185                double y = r.getY();
186                double w = r.getWidth();
187                double h = r.getHeight();
188                Pnt2d[] pts = new Pnt2d[4];
189                pts[0] = PntDouble.from(x, y);
190                pts[1] = PntDouble.from(x + w - 1, y);  // TODO: does -1 matter? YES - it seems WRONG!!!
191                pts[2] = PntDouble.from(x + w - 1, y + h - 1);
192                pts[3] = PntDouble.from(x, y + h - 1);
193                //IJ.log("getpoints2:  p1-4 = " + pts[0] + ", " + pts[1] + ", " + pts[2] + ", " + pts[3]);
194                return pts;
195        }
196        
197        private final Random rg = new Random();
198        
199        private Pnt2d perturbGaussian(Pnt2d p) {
200                double x = p.getX();
201                double y = p.getY();
202                x = x + rg.nextGaussian() * sigma;
203                y = y + rg.nextGaussian() * sigma;
204                return PntDouble.from(x, y);
205        }
206        
207        private Pnt2d[] perturbGaussian(Pnt2d[] pntsIn) {
208                Pnt2d[] pntsOut = pntsIn.clone();
209                for (int i = 0; i < pntsIn.length; i++) {
210                        pntsOut[i] = perturbGaussian(pntsIn[i]);
211                }
212                return pntsOut;
213        }
214        
215        private Roi makePolygon(Pnt2d[] points, double strokeWidth, Color color) {
216                Path2D poly = new Path2D.Double();
217                if (points.length > 0) {
218                        poly.moveTo(points[0].getX(), points[0].getY());
219                        for (int i = 1; i < points.length; i++) {
220                                poly.lineTo(points[i].getX(), points[i].getY());
221                        }
222                        poly.closePath();
223                }
224                Roi shapeRoi = new ShapeRoi(poly);
225                shapeRoi.setStrokeWidth(strokeWidth);
226                shapeRoi.setStrokeColor(color);
227                return shapeRoi;
228        }
229
230}
